result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W. Pfister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victim without her consent and consent of probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report. If probation is revoked, 1 day sentence credit is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua W. Pfister

defendant.name: Pfister, Joshua W.
defendant.address: 6835 Lost Lake Rd, Egg Harbor, WI 54209

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d). DA has no objection.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation. Defense gives joint sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Domestic Abuse Battery, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz advises matter is close to resolving, requests another status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
from defendants mother on his behalf.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Reetz asks court to set arraignment date. Bond remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting prelim. later in the morning on 11/11/14 because of a conflict. Court reschedules to 11:00 am, same day.
Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from ADA Korb asking court to reschedule 10/15/14 prelim. because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/17/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/25/15)

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains in effect.
No violent contact with A.P.    To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua W. Pfister appears by video conference.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates he doesn't qualify for PD representation. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
